Package chesspieces

Class ChessPiece

java.lang.Object
chesspieces.ChessPiece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class ChessPiece extends Object
The ChessPiece class represents a generic chess piece in a chess game with methods that any chess piece, regardless of type, can call
Author:
Eric Zhang, Stanley Cai

  • Constructor Details

    • ChessPiece

      public ChessPiece(ChessPiece[][] board, int row, int col, Team team, King selfKing)
      Create a generic chess piece
      Parameters:
      board - - the chessboard that the piece will reside in
      row - - the starting row position of the piece on the board
      col - - the starting column position of the piece on the board
      team - - the team of this chess piece (white or black)
      selfKing - - the King of this chess piece's team (null for the King itself)

  • Method Details

    • attemptMoveTo

      public abstract boolean attemptMoveTo(int targetRow, int targetCol, int currentMoveNumber)
      Attempt to move a chess piece from its current location to [targetRow, targetCol]
      Parameters:
      targetRow - - row position to go to
      targetCol - - column position to go to
      currentMoveNumber - - move number of the current move in the game
      Returns:
      whether the chess piece successfully moved to [targetRow, targetCol]

    • canMoveTo

      public abstract boolean canMoveTo(int targetRow, int targetCol, boolean checkPutSelfKingInCheck)
      Determine if the chess piece can legally move to [targetRow, targetCol]
      Parameters:
      targetRow - - the row for the piece to go to
      targetCol - - the column for the piece to go to
      checkPutSelfKingInCheck - - checks whether own king will be in check after your own move
      Returns:
      whether the chess piece can legally move to [targetRow, targetCol]

    • willPutSelfKingInCheckAt

      public boolean willPutSelfKingInCheckAt(int targetRow, int targetCol)
      Determine if moving to this location will put selfKing in check. Precondition: this piece can legally move to this location otherwise
      Parameters:
      targetRow - - the row that the piece will go to
      targetCol - - the column that the piece will go to
      Returns:
      if selfKing will be put in check after this piece moves to [targetRow, targetCol]

    • getBoard

      public ChessPiece[][] getBoard()
      Get the board that the chess piece is in (or was in before being captured)
      Returns:
      the board that the chess piece is/was in

    • getCol

      public int getCol()
      Search the board for the chess piece, and return its column position on the board
      Returns:
      the column position of the chess piece on the chessboard, or -1 if the piece is no longer on the board

    • getRow

      public int getRow()
      Search the board for the chess piece, and return its row position on the chessboard
      Returns:
      the row position of the chess piece on the chessboard, or -1 if the piece is no longer on the board

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation(int row, int col)
      Do the actual updating of the chess piece's location. Precondition: the chess piece can legally move to this location
      Parameters:
      row - - the row of the location to move to
      col - - the column of the location to move to
